clinical_study.brief_title: Solid Tumor Cancer Surgery With or Without Intraoperative Imaging: A Registry
clinical_study.official_title: Solid Tumor Cancer Surgery With or Without Intraoperative Imaging: A Registry Optional Sub-Study I: ICG Optional Sub-Study II: OTL38

brief_summary.textblock: The study objective is to collect prospective data on cancer patients who undergo surgery and intraoperative imaging. The registry will include (but not limited to) cancer type, stage, intraoperative challenges to the surgeon, usage and results of intraoperative imaging, and recurrence surveillance.

primary_outcome.description: Enhance ability to detect malignant tissues in situ and ex vivo.

intervention.description: Patients will be given imaging agent 2-3 hours before surgery to assist in imaging.
Patients will be given imaging agent 24 hours before surgery to assist in imaging.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a high clinical suspicion of cancer, scheduled to undergo surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients >/= 18 years of age.
- Patients presenting with esophagogastric or bladder cancer.
- Good operative candidate as determined by the treating physician and/or multidisciplinary team.
- Subject capable of giving informed consent and participating in the process of consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women as determined by urinary or serum beta hCG within 72 hours of surgery.
- Vulnerable patient population.
